actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. on January 22, 2024.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Thursday, January 18, 2024 through Sunday, January 28, 2024 as a "district work period."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. S. Con. Res. 25 — "Providing for a correction in the enrollment of H.R. 2872."
Mr. Diaz-Balart asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.

The House received a message from the Deputy Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Deputy Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on January 18, 2024, at 3:26 p.m.: That the Senate agreed to S. Con. Res. 25.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. S. 3222 — "To ensure the security of office space rented by Senators, and for other purposes."
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3058 — "To amend parts B and E of title IV of the Social Security Act to improve foster and adoptive parent recruitment and retention, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4250 — "To maintain the free flow of information to the public by establishing appropriate limits on the federally compelled disclosure of information obtained as part of engaging in journalism, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3667 — "To amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide for the reissuance of social security account numbers to young children in cases where confidentiality has been compromised."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1568 — "To amend the Tariff Act of 1930 to protect personally identifiable information, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 212
actions-list.actionItem: 207 (Roll no. 19).

actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 207
actions-list.actionItem: 213 (Roll no. 18).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 6914 — "To require institutions of higher education to disseminate information on the rights of, and accommodations and resources for, pregnant students, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 214
actions-list.actionItem: 208 (Roll no. 17).

actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 208
actions-list.actionItem: 214 (Roll no. 16).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 6918 — "To prohibit the Secretary of Health and Human Services from restricting funding for pregnancy centers."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 314
actions-list.actionItem: 108 (Roll no. 15).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 413
actions-list.actionItem: 7 (Roll no. 14).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 3250 — "To provide remote access to court proceedings for victims of the 1988 Bombing of Pan Am Flight 103 over Lockerbie, Scotland."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on the motions to suspend the rules on S. 3250 and the Senate amendment to H.R. 2872, on the motion to recommit H.R. 6918 and passage of the bill, if ordered, and on the motion to recommit H.R. 6914 and passage of the bill, if ordered.

At the conclusion of debate on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2872, the chair put the question on the motion and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Roy demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with 40 minutes of debate on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2872.
Ms. Granger moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.

The House received a message from the Deputy Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Deputy Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on January 18, 2024, at 3:04 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 2414 and H.R. 2872, with an amendment, and agreed to S. Res. 523.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 6914, the chair put the question on the motion to recommit and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Underwood demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Underwood moved to recommit to the Committee on Education and the Workforce.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 6914.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 6914, H.R. 6918 and H. Res. 957. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 6914, H.R. 6918, and H. Res. 957 under a closed rule, with one hour of general debate on each measure. The resolution provides for a motion to recommit on H.R. 6914 and H.R. 6918.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 969. H.R. 6914 — "To require institutions of higher education to disseminate information on the rights of, and accommodations and resources for, pregnant students, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 6918, the chair put the question on the motion to recommit and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Smith (MO) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Davids (KS) moved to recommit to the Committee on Ways and Means.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 6918.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 6914, H.R. 6918 and H. Res. 957. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 6914, H.R. 6918, and H. Res. 957 under a closed rule, with one hour of general debate on each measure. The resolution provides for a motion to recommit on H.R. 6914 and H.R. 6918.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 969. H.R. 6918 — "To prohibit the Secretary of Health and Human Services from restricting funding for pregnancy centers."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Quigley to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Derrick Van Orden to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
